intro: Ptilotus manglesii, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and distinctive, hairy leaves. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and it is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Ptilotus manglesii thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
